topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/533f2dd86368726e53360100#post_533f2dd86368726e53360100

Much beer, many bars, and though nothing special going on this weekend: there's plenty of music.

Spent the day after landing having lunch at the Magnolia (I think?) grill just down the road from my hotel. It rained a bit, so we came back for it to clean up (and so my stepmom can charge her phone). Then I was shown around the French Quarter by my dad and familiarized with Bourbon Street itself, all the way going to a few bars for a round or two at each before walking on to the next to walk off the drinks. Some minor discussion on what to do tomorrow and the rest of the few days I'm here, and a visit to the French Market for a hat, since I decided I needed something to keep the sun out of my eyes right now.

Feet are tired, I'm hot and tired, and we're waiting to hit up a place that opens up only for dinner to eat. So far: a good start. Hoping that the next four days won't be all rain and thunder as predicted and we'll have some proper sunny windows to do fun things.

Also our Taxi driver from the airport to our corner of the French Quarter we're pretty sure was a insane driver. Like, one cartoon world away from being a character in Crazy Taxi.
topics.author: 4fe4bf947f123b175b000001

topics.body:
"@AaronMk":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/533f31e56368722b280b0000#post_533f31e56368722b280b0000
Are they still cleaning up and rebuilding down there after Katrina or is everything back to normal?
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e

topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/533f326c6368726ea4c10200#post_533f326c6368726ea4c10200

It's all back to normal as far as I can tell and as far as my Dad pointed out.

He came down here after Katrina to help out in the clean up and repair work. So he has a post-disaster insight and even on the way to the hotel he pointed out how the bridge we were on was destroyed and how such-and-such sky-scrapers were stripped of their windows to so high up. And from what he said: it's certainly turned around and is rebuilt.

The French Quarter, where we're at, apparently only had two-inches of flood water, despite being four-five stories below sea level and the Mississippi.
topics.author: 4fe4bf947f123b175b000001

topics.body: Alright, I just got out of the dentist, and they removed my wisdom teeth. Any suggestions on what kind of foods should I eat? I will be crying in pain soon :)
topics.author: 31bee2686368722a0df23600

topics.body:
"@Gizoid101":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/533f36766368727d1d2a0200#post_533f36766368727d1d2a0200
Soup?
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@Gizoid101":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/533f36766368727d1d2a0200#post_533f36766368727d1d2a0200

Nothing through a straw. Spoon only. Yogurt mostly.

Avoiding "sucking" as much as you can. If I remember from my experience with the same, it could tear out the stitches or what not they got where your wisdom teeth were and could cause some painful issues later.

Then again, I'm sure I subsisted on nothing for a couple days since I might have been too high on painkillers to care. So I don't remember.
topics.author: 4fe4bf947f123b175b000001

topics.body:
"@Gizoid101":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/533f36766368727d1d2a0200#post_533f36766368727d1d2a0200
As someone who got five wisdom teeth removed you're going to be too high to be able to eat.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
